subject: Re: Map adjustments.
body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Thanks for sending this over! I'll send to my team now. 
	
 
Caroline Fraher
Account Executive



 https://www.instagram.com/flocksafety/ 

 <https://gifo.srv.wisestamp.com/s/rfcustom/108062/26/trans.png>  caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com 

	
 https://www.flocksafety.com/articles/flock-safety-secures-major-funding?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=LETSM&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

	
 	 
 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/LqYnr2GL2QLy.png> 


On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 8:41?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:


	Updated map items.

	 

	F#44 needs to be moved.  I would like to move it to River Road, just north of Maxwell Road. Preferably it would catch southbound traffic right before Maxwell.

	 

	F#016 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Willamette Street just south of 24th but looking northbound.  

	 

	F#005 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to E 7th Avenue just east of High Street to catch if cars are going to Coburg Road or towards Broadway.

	 

	F#009 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Seneca, north of West 5th

	 

	F#010 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Seneca, south of West 5th.

	 

	F#019 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Maxwell Road, East of the Maxwell Connector.

	 

	F#031 should be moved to capture more data.  Highway 99 south of Roosevelt Blvd, catching southbound traffic.

	 

	F#021 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to East Broadway @ Ferry Street.  With the intent of capturing vehicle as they go straight onto Mill Street or continue onto East Broadway, westbound.

	 

	F#039 should be moved to capture more data.  We are talked about this one previously, so I don�t know if it was a property line issue.  The preference would for the camera to still catch southbound highway 99 but south of Prairie Road to get both major arterials.  Is that possible?

	 

	F#015 is a duplicate so that one can be removed from the map.  I would like to move it to private property to catch I-5.   The address is 89733 Armitage Road, Eugene, Oregon.  I spoke to the owner of the property, Mike Johnson and he approved its placement.  He will sign the associated form we need for that if you want to send it over.  I scouted the location and I am including map markers and photos from the ground and what it can see.  Let me know if you need anything else on that one.

	 

	Sorry for the adjustments, as we look at some of these locations, it just makes more sense for well-traveled roads.  Again, if the specific locations have issues, flexing forward or backwards is possible.  I am happy to speak directly to the person making the changes.

	 

	Derek

	 

	Detective D. DeWitt

	Financial Crimes Unit

	Special Weapons and Tactics Team

	Background Investigations Team

	Eugene Police Department

	300 County Club Road

	Eugene, OR 97401

	Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

	Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

	Work Cell � 541-743-6192

	 

	From: Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com > 
	Sent: Thursday, March 27, 2025 1:35 PM
	To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
	Subject: Re: PD & Flock Safety- Kick off Call

	 

	[EXTERNAL ?]

	Yes, here is the link. Eugene Deployment Map ORC https://sales.flocksafety.com/t/102869/sc/abed574d-52cc-411b-9e8d--flocksafety-com-planning-portal-deployment-tracker-public-0f92e14e8  

	 

	Can you please let me know if we need to make any changes? I "approved" the locations so I could mark the contract as complete in our system, but we're a-ok to make any needed changes. 

	 

	 

	
 https://sales.flocksafety.com/t/102869/sc/abed574d-52cc-411b-9e8d--com 

Caroline Fraher
Account Executive

On Tue, Apr 1, 2025 at 8:41?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:


	Updated map items.

	 

	F#44 needs to be moved.  I would like to move it to River Road, just north of Maxwell Road. Preferably it would catch southbound traffic right before Maxwell.

	 

	F#016 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Willamette Street just south of 24th but looking northbound.  

	 

	F#005 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to E 7th Avenue just east of High Street to catch if cars are going to Coburg Road or towards Broadway.

	 

	F#009 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Seneca, north of West 5th

	 

	F#010 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Seneca, south of West 5th.

	 

	F#019 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to Maxwell Road, East of the Maxwell Connector.

	 

	F#031 should be moved to capture more data.  Highway 99 south of Roosevelt Blvd, catching southbound traffic.

	 

	F#021 should be moved to capture more data.  That camera would be moved to East Broadway @ Ferry Street.  With the intent of capturing vehicle as they go straight onto Mill Street or continue onto East Broadway, westbound.

	 

	F#039 should be moved to capture more data.  We are talked about this one previously, so I don�t know if it was a property line issue.  The preference would for the camera to still catch southbound highway 99 but south of Prairie Road to get both major arterials.  Is that possible?

	 

	F#015 is a duplicate so that one can be removed from the map.  I would like to move it to private property to catch I-5.   The address is 89733 Armitage Road, Eugene, Oregon.  I spoke to the owner of the property, Mike Johnson and he approved its placement.  He will sign the associated form we need for that if you want to send it over.  I scouted the location and I am including map markers and photos from the ground and what it can see.  Let me know if you need anything else on that one.

	 

	Sorry for the adjustments, as we look at some of these locations, it just makes more sense for well-traveled roads.  Again, if the specific locations have issues, flexing forward or backwards is possible.  I am happy to speak directly to the person making the changes.

	 

	Derek

	 

	Detective D. DeWitt

	Financial Crimes Unit

	Special Weapons and Tactics Team

	Background Investigations Team

	Eugene Police Department

	300 County Club Road

	Eugene, OR 97401

	Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

	Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

	Work Cell � 541-743-6192
